result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Sipari was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber privileges.   IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.
***Probation is CONSECUTIVE to the Jail Sentences that the Defendant is currently serving.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------

No possession of alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia unless with a valid prescription.
Undergo an alcohol and other drub abuse assessment and follow through with any reccommendations.
----------------------

Undergo an alcohol and other drug abuse assessment and follow through with any recommendations.
---------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
----------------------  
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
----------------------
The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees. 
----------------------

Attorney Travis Schwantes appeared.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not in court. Court orders warrant and bond forfeited. Minutes filed.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Atty Travis Schwantes
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH G.K.   "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH D.S.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Nicholas J Sipari appeared, Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
